00005 #include"PGBasics.hh"
00006 #include"LSTDQController.hh"

00008 // An initial value for the AInverse matrix corresponding to an initial A
00009 // which is a small fraction of the identity matrix 
00010 #define IDENT_SCALE (1.0/0.001)
00011 
00012 using namespace std;
00013 namespace libpg {
00014 
00023     LSTDQController::LSTDQController(Approximator* approx, Policy* policy, double tdDiscount) : ValueController(approx) {
00024 
00025         this->policy = policy;
00026         this->tdDiscount = tdDiscount;
00027 
00028         // The total size of the param vector should be actions*getNumInputs()
00029         // in the linear case
00030         lstdqDimension = approx->getNumParams();
00031         
00032         I.resize(lstdqDimension, lstdqDimension);
00033         I.assign(identity_matrix<double>(lstdqDimension));
00034         I *= IDENT_SCALE; 
00035 
00036         //A.resize(lstdqDimension, lstdqDimension);
00037         AInverse.resize(lstdqDimension, lstdqDimension);
00038         AInverse.clear();
00039 
00040         values.resize(approx->getOutputDim()); // The number of actions
00041         
00042         lstdqTD.resize(lstdqDimension);
00043         lstdqTrace.resize(lstdqDimension);
00044         lstdqTrace.clear();
00045         bVec.resize(lstdqDimension);
00046         bVec.clear();
00047         lstdqWeights.resize(lstdqDimension);
00048         lstdqWeights.clear();
00049 
00050         previousPhi.resize(lstdqDimension);
00051         previousPhi.clear();
00052         currentPhi.resize(lstdqDimension);
00053         currentPhi.clear();
00054         
00055         instantStepRequired = false;
00056         lstdqSteps = 0;
00057                 
00058     }

00065         
00066     }

00072     void LSTDQController::getAction(Observation& obs, Vector& action, bool learn) {
00073 
00074         assert(obs.getFeatures().size1() == (size_t)getInputDim());
00075         
00076         // Doing an approx step computes values
00077         approx->doApprox(obs, values);
00078 
00079 
00080         // Now values stores the q values over all the actions for the
00081         // current state (features)
00082         policy->getAction(values, action, obs);
00083 
00084 
00085         if (learn) {
00086         
00087             // Compute the basis feature phi by a
00088             // feedbackGrad(). Relies on this being a linear
00089             // approximator!!
00090             values.clear();
00091             values[(size_t)action[0]] = 1.0;
00092 
00093             // feedbackGrad puts the result in the trace
00094             approx->resetTrace();
00095             approx->feedbackGrad(obs, values);
00096             
00097             // Save the previous phi 
00098             previousPhi = currentPhi;
00099 
00100             // extract the phi for the basis feature and action just chosen.
00101             currentPhi.clear();
00102             approx->reduce(currentPhi, Approximator::TRACES);
00103 
00104             // Do a step if required
00105             if (instantStepRequired) delayedInstantStep(lastReward, obs.getSteps());
00106             
00107         }
00108         
00109     }
00110

00113     // Reset just the eligibility trace. Note that LSTDQ typically
00114     // assumes \lambda=0, so this would do nothing in that case.
00115     void LSTDQController::resetTrace() {
00116         lstdqTrace.clear();
00117         AInverse.assign(I); 
00118     }
00119

00126      void LSTDQController::resetGrad() {
00127          bVec.clear();
00128          lstdqTrace.clear();  
00129          AInverse.assign(I); 
00130          lstdqSteps = 0;
00131      }

00138     void LSTDQController::instantStep(Vector& reward) {
00139 
00140         // Don't know how to do multiple agents here, although it could be done.
00141         assert(reward.size() == 1);
00142 
00143         // Have to use the previous reward, not the current one.
00144         lastReward = oldReward;
00145         oldReward = reward[0];
00146         instantStepRequired = true;
00147 
00148     }
00149

00157     void LSTDQController::delayedInstantStep(double reward, int steps) {
00158 
00159         assert(instantStepRequired);
00160 
00161         updateStatistics(reward, steps);
00162 
00163         computeDirection(steps);
00164     
00165         // Update the parameters.
00166         approx->scatter(lstdqWeights, Approximator::PARAMS);
00167         
00168         //cout<<"New weights="<<lstdqWeights<<endl;
00169 
00170         
00171         instantStepRequired = false;
00172 
00173     }

00180     void LSTDQController::accumulateGrad(Vector& reward, Observation& newObs) {
00181 
00182 
00183         updateStatistics(oldReward, newObs.getSteps());
00184         oldReward = reward[0];
00185     }

00192     void LSTDQController::updateStatistics(double reward, int steps) {
00193 
00194         // Increment the eligibility trace by lambda
00195         // for real LSTDQ discount=0.0
00196         lstdqTrace *= discount;
00197         lstdqTrace += previousPhi;
00198 
00199         //cout<<"Step "<<steps<<endl;
00200         //cout<<"\tlstdqTrace(lambda="<<discount<<")="<<lstdqTrace<<endl;
00201 
00202         // Add in the observed feature (basis vector) for the "current" state, which 
00203         // is actually the previous state we observed.
00204         // previousPhi = phi_{t-1}
00205         lstdqTD = previousPhi;
00206         
00207 
00208         // Subtract off the future (i.e., actually the current) observation * discount
00209         // Note that both phi's depend on the actions that were chosen
00210         lstdqTD  -= tdDiscount*currentPhi;
00211 
00212         //cout<<"\tlstdqTD="<<lstdqTD<<endl;
00213 
00214         // Okay, we have computed the TD part of the vector. Now do
00215         // outer product with trace to update A. Although in fact,
00216         // since what we want in the end is the inverse of A, lets
00217         // update that directly using the Sherman-Morrison
00218         // formulation.  If this ever becomes a higher rank update, it
00219         // uses Sherman-Morrison-Woodbury
00220 
00221         // Alpha implements a moving average of A and b. This stops
00222         // them blowing up in infinite horizon settings. Be warned
00223         // that this is probably not the right thing to do while the
00224         // policy is changing. In that case, decay A and bVec but add
00225         // in constant new terms.
00226         double alpha = 1.0 - 1.0/(++lstdqSteps); // First steps value should be 1.0
00227 
00228         if (alpha > 0) AInverse /= alpha; // same as multiplying A by alpha
00229 
00230         lstdqTD *= (1.0 - alpha); // This will weight the new contribution to A by (1.0 - alpha)
00231         //cout<<"\talpha (lstdqSteps)="<<alpha<<" ("<<lstdqSteps<<")"<<endl;
00232         //cout<<"\tAInverse="<<AInverse<<endl;
00233         //cout<<"\tlstdqTD="<<lstdqTD<<endl;
00234 
00235         // If \lambda = 0, then lpiTrace is just the current (i.e.,
00236         // previous) observation vec embedded in a bunch of 0's
00237         // depending on the action that was chosen.  Should check that
00238         // it's not the future observation vec.
00239         UBlasExtras::updateInverseMatrix(AInverse, lstdqTrace, lstdqTD);
00240         
00241         //cout<<"\tA^-1="<<AInverse<<endl;
00242 
00243         bVec *= alpha;
00244         
00245         // Update normal (GPOMDP style) gradient
00246         bVec += reward*(1.0 - alpha)*lstdqTrace;
00247 
00248         //cout<<"\tr="<<reward<<endl;
00249         //cout<<"\tb="<<bVec<<endl;
00250 
00251     }
00252 
00253 
00258     void LSTDQController::computeDirection(int) {
00259 
00260         // Calculate the new weights lstdqWeights (the w vector)
00261         axpy_prod(AInverse, bVec, lstdqWeights, true); // true = set lstdqWeights to 0 first
00262 
00263     }
00264

00272     void LSTDQController::batchStep() {
00273    
00274         // Give the approximator the new solution.
00275         approx->scatter(lstdqWeights, Approximator::PARAMS);
00276         resetGrad();
00277 
00278     }

00281     void LSTDQController::reduce(Vector& v, Approximator::StatsEnum s) {
00282 
00283         switch (s) {
00284         case Approximator::TRACES: // Deliberate fall through 
00285         case Approximator::PARAMS: 
00286             assert(v.size() == (size_t)getNumParams());
00287             v.assign(project(lstdqWeights, range(0, getNumParams())));
00288             break;
00289         case Approximator::GRADS: 
00290             approx->reduce(v, s);
00291             break;
00292         default:
00293             NYI
00294                 }
00295     }
00296 
00297 
00298     void LSTDQController::scatter(Vector& v, Approximator::StatsEnum s) { 
00299     
00300         switch (s) {
00301         case Approximator::PARAMS: 
00302             assert(v.size() == (size_t)getNumParams());
00303             project(lstdqWeights, range(0, getNumParams())).assign(v);
00304             break;
00305         case Approximator::TRACES: // Deliberate fall through
00306         case Approximator::GRADS:
00307             approx->scatter(v, s);
00308             break;
00309         default:
00310             throw runtime_error("LSTDQController::scatter() unknown type\n");
00311         }
00312 
00313     }

00319     void LSTDQController::setDiscount(double discount) {
00320 
00321         this->discount = discount;
00322         approx->setDiscount(discount);
00323 
00324     }
